main event: On November 6, 1957, in Lexington, Kentucky, there was a ground visual observation of a round long streamer, ft. in diameter, waving or vibrating and blinking straight down for about 1 second. The object was seen flying with the characteristics of a meteor and was in sight for 5 to 10 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as a round long streamer, waving or vibrating, and blinking straight down for about 1 second.
It was seen flying with the characteristics of a meteor and was in sight for 5 to 10 seconds.
The report indicates that all the characteristics are consistent with that of a meteor, and no photographs were included in the report.

Additionally, a similar report from December 1952 in Lexington, Kentucky, mentioned an object the size of a pinhead heading northeastward and in sight for three minutes, which was suggested to be caused by an aircraft.
sighted object: round long streamer with waving or vibrating movement
